subject: Re: [junit] Do you think this example is a reasonable use of JUnit???
msgSnippet: ... I m a bit shocked by: public class QueriesTest extends Assert { It feels so nineties :-) How about using a static import instead? -- Cédric
messageBody:
On 11/2/06, Brett L. Schuchert <schuchert@...> wrote:
>
> I'm working on some materials for people to learn JPA in a JSE
> environment. I decided I wanted them to write a series of unit tests
> to test several different queries and ultimately use a test-oriented
> approach to infer the API.
>
> What I came up with (pass 1) is at the bottom of this page:
> http://schuchert.wikispaces.com/JPA+Tutorial+2+-+Working+with+Queries+1
>
> Do you have any opinions about how I've used JUnit here?


I'm a bit shocked by:

public class QueriesTest extends Assert {

It feels so nineties :-)

How about using a static import instead?

--
Cédric
http://testng.org


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
